result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew T Bradley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).
  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution Disbursed to Reflections Jewelry per 5/22/15 order.
Clerks Note: Per the State, the address for the victim Reflections Jewelry is 1306 W Forrest Home Ave, Milwaukee, Wi 53204
Restitution Disbursed to Grade-Tech Pavers per 5/22/15 order.
Order to disburse
Restitution Request & Proposed Order to Disburse
Letter from JCJ informing the Court that the Defendant's Huber has been revoked
Huber/work release notification
With criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 11:10 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On Motion of the State, the Court amends Counts #1, #2 & #3, to Class A misdemeanors, contrary to 943.41(5)(a) - fraudulant use of a financial transaction card

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Amended Counts #1, #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #4, #5, #6 & #9

On Counts #1, #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail (on Count #1), with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence 5/1/15 at 7:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment
--To undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $729 ($243 each count)
--To pay $600 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--To pay $99 subpoena fees
--To pay restitution of $438.02, payable to Grave Tech Pavers, joint & several with Charles Wood
--To pay restitution of $150, payable to Reflections Jewelry, joint & several with Charles Wood
--To pay 10% restitution surcharge
--No contact with Charles Wood

Days credit for time already served: 1 day
Recess: 11:32 am
Bond Payment Information
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Surety info
Duplicate original warrant & extradition forecast returned//def made voluntary appearance
Def. made voluntary appearance/ Court quashed warrarnt

[MK] case called at 10:02am. 
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa.  ADA John Fryatt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa requests that the case be scheduled for change of plea and sentencing; there is a plea agreement in place. 
The Court indicates that this is not for this Intake Court to sort out.  The Court instructs the JCSO Deputy to take Mr. Bradley into custody on the Warrant.    
In response to the Attorney De La Rosa's inquiries about the County's voluntary appearance procedure, the Court indicates that it cannot be expected to sort out the case court record with two minutes-notice.

ADA Fryatt motions for the Court to set $250 cash bond.  
The Court sets a $250 cash baond requiement.   [The Warrant is quashed.
recess 10:10am. 

NEXT:  Plea & Sentencing on April 9th at 10:00am.
Extradition forecast

Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty De La Rosa informs the Court that he has no explanation for non-appearance
AD AHall requests warrant
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only
Court cancels trial and informs parties that witnesses may be released

Case called at 10:59 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for FSSC)
[Reserve Judge Donald Hassin presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty De La Rosa requests that he be given a chance to discuss matter further with prosecutor and that it remain on trial calendar. Should know by end of business tomorrow if trial will proceed.
ADA Beck inquires of Atty De La Rosa if a Miranda Goodchild Hearing will be needed
Court informs parties that It will adjourn FSSC to Thursday. Court directs State to have witness available for a Miranda Goodchild hearing which will be address at the adjourned FSSC. Court advises parties not to cancel witnesses for trial.
Court orders Atty De La Rosa to advise State by noon 3/18/15 whether or not witness/Miranda Goodchild hearing is needed, on 3/19/15 at 10:30 am at adjourned FSSC
Recess: 11:03 am

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
case called at 8:54am. [MK]
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Det. Daniel Horvatin -sworn & testifies
--direct examination by ADA Shock
--State's Exhibit #1:  Detective Horvatin's Supplemental Report-- offered; received only for the limited purposes and the limited excerpts that were testified to
--cross examination by Attorney De La Rosa
Brief argument given by Attorney De La Rosa

The Court finds probable cause that Mr. Bradley committed a felony. The Court binds him over for further proceedings. 

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the Court confirms that the charges and maximum penalties are the same as those set forth in the Criminal Complaint. recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
The Court continues the bond.
recess 9:13am.

Case called at 9:08 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Mr. Bradley informs the Court that he has retained Chris Hartley as counsel, but he was unable to make today's hearing. Do have meeting with another counsel today at 11:00 am, as not happy with current counsel.
Upon discussion of Court/State - Court schedules preliminary hearing
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Mr. Bradley
Recess: 9:12 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 10/3/2014 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case
Defendant signed bond on 8/25/14, bond returned to COC by JCSD on 8/26/14

Case called at 2:05 pm
Defendant Matthew T Bradley in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Yelena Zarwell from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (Attorney Zarwell informs the Court that Mr. Bradley informed her that he privately retained Attorney Chris Behning). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $10,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with co-defendant Charles Wood
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin
-Not to have any contact with any known employees or Management of Grade-Tech Pavers or any presence at any job site that it is known they are working at or present at their home offices

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given

Recess: 2:24
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
Status: 9/5/14 at 9:00 am (Court does not order PTC be set due to the Defendant retaining Attorney Behning)
